title: What is your favourite song at the moment? - Quora

One of my favorite songs right now, and has been for some time, is Things Behind the Sun by Nick Drake. Nick Drake is an English guitar and singer-songwriter who had relatively no public appearances or knowledge about him before he died early on in his life. The lyrics of the song are not only perfectly written and beautiful, but are truly thought-provoking. Here are the lyrics: Please beware of them that stare They'll only smile to see you while Your time away And once you've seen what they have been To win the earth just won't seem worth Your night or your day Who'll hear what I say. Look around you find the ground Is not so far from where you are But not too wise For down below they never grow They're always tired and charms are hired From out of their eyes Never surprise. Take your time and you'll be fine And say a prayer for people there Who live on the floor And if you see what's meant to be Don't name the day or try to say It happened before. Don't be shy you learn to fly And see the sun when day is done If only you see Just what you are beneath a star That came to stay one rainy day In autumn for free Yes, be what you'll be. Please beware of them that stare They'll only smile to see you while Your time away And once you've seen what they have been To win the earth just won't seem worth Your night or your day Who'll hear what I say. Open up the broken cup Let goodly sin and sunshine in Yes that's today. And open wide the hymns you hide You find renown while people frown At things that you say But say what you'll say About the farmers and the fun And the things behind the sun And the people around your head Who say everything's been said And the movement in your brain Sends you out into the rain. These lyrics perfectly encapsulate the reclusive life of Nick Drake and, in a way, explain the emotions he must have been feeling at the time. The music is simple yet sublime, with only a guitar and voice. The song is minor in key the entire time, until the very end when it turns to major key. This shift in mood perfectly symbolizes the life of Nick Drake. He suffered from major depression throughout his life and retreated from the public eye. He refused to be interviewed or play live, and never found great commercial success in his lifetime. He died at the age of 26 due to a suicidal drug overdose. However, his music gradually became more appreciated after his death to the point where there are documentaries and biographies being released about him today. His life was grim for quite a while, but ended with a happy conclusion and continues to be appreciated today. This song carries so much meaning and I love listening to it. Nick Drake

(Originally asked: What is your favorite song at the moment?) Right this minute? Just one song? Okay. In my car right now is the new Steven Wilson ep, 4 1/2, which I've been cranking away on for a couple of days now after giving it a rest for a month or so. But everytime I hear it, or for that matter, many things he does, I'm in. This time he got me with the opening track, "My Book Of Regrets." What a great Progressive Rock opener!

My personal favourite song is our National Anthem JAN-GANA-MANA (जन गण मन) . Whenever I hear this song, I get a shiver travelling from my toe to hair and giving me divine freshness. The mere sound of this beloved song fills me with devotion towards my country and reminds me the greatness of my country. No other song,however melodious or great or whatever it is,can never give me such a thrill. This legendary song was written by our beloved poet and Nobel Laureate Rabindranath Tagore. Here is wiki link-Jana Gana Mana | Wikiwand  Lyrics and translation- Lyrics Hindi- जन गण मन अधिनायक जय हे भारत भाग्यविधाता पंजाब सिन्धु गुजरात मराठा द्राविड़ उत्कल बंग विन्ध्य हिमाचल यमुना गंगा उच्छल जलधि तरंग तव शुभ नामे जागे तव शुभ आशीष मागे गाहे तव जयगाथा जन गण मंगलदायक जय हे भारत भाग्यविधाता जय हे, जय हे, जय हे जय जय जय जय हे! English- Jana-Gan-Mana-Adhinayaka, Jaya He Bharata-Bhagya-Vidhata Punjab-Sindhu-Gujarata-Maratha Dravida-Utkala-Banga Vindhya-Himachala-Yamuna-Ganga Uchchhala-JaladthaTaranga Tava Subha Name Jage Tava Subha Ashisa Mage Gahe Tava Jaya Gatha. Jana-Gana-Mangala Dayaka, Jaya He Bharata-Bhagya-Vidhata, Jaya He, Jaya He, Jaya He, Jaya, Jaya, Jaya, Jaya He English translation : Thou art the rulers of the minds of all people, dispenser of India's destiny. Thy name rouses the hearts of Punjab, Sindh , Gujarat and Maratha, Of the Dravida and Orissa and Bengal; It echoes in the hills of the Vindhyas and Himalayas, mingles in the music of Yamuna and Ganga and is chanted by the waves of the Indian Sea. They pray for the blessings and sing thy praise. The saving of all people waits in the hand, thou dispenser of India's destiny, Victory, victory, victory to thee. Here is its video in case you want to hear it. But do stand up on ''Attention'' position before hearing it.  Here is another artistic video composed by A R Rehman and featuring some of the best classical music artists of India :   -Tirthkumar Patel

These days my favorite songs are <Amazing Day> and <Everglow> ,which are both from Coldplay. Everytime when I'm listening to these songs,I feel like I'm about to cry. And I’ve read someone’s comment about the song<Everglow>, and it goes like “it doesn't matter which band or which music genre you're in love with. What does matter is that you can hear the nights, the tears, the passion, the hurt and that hold-on-to-smile self who’s been suffering all those pain and despair from their music.” Music,movies and all the artworks are very subjective things. It’s only about your feeling. No matter how people judge it or comment on it, it’s you who’s got the feeling. I'm not a fan of Coldplay.But I still appreciate their music has given me such a great affection, making me feel warm in those heartbroken nights. "Sat on the roof,named every star. Shed every bruise and showed every scar.”

Out on the hills in the countryside, lying on a blanket under the stars. Take some LSD and bring some cans. Play these 3 songs and you'll have an amazing experience. Ps. Wear a warm coat because you'll get cold if you don't as you won't feel it from the alcohol. https://youtu.be/A7ZxRs45tTg https://youtu.be/j21l4LEtHbA https://youtu.be/LDIoxgnl-ho This is my favourite song for the car right now:

Personally, I like "Jessica" by Major Lazer and Ezra Koenig at the moment.  The lyrics indicate a person who is in lopic with a person named Jessica, yet that's on the surface. Fake German words, the usage of a Porsche as a bathing suit dryer, and the ignoring of a "mother crying upstairs" gives an odd, yet intriguing character who could be interpreted in many ways indeed.  Also, the music is very unconventional; it's a combination of rock, reggae, and electronic (but not electronic dance), and its tempo is slow but loping, making its instrumental as intriguing as the lyrics. And yes, it sounds great too!

I don't care, go on and tear me apart.I don't care if you do, ooh!Cause in a sky,cause in a sky full of stars.I think I saw you. Cause you're a sky, cause you're a sky full of stars.I wanna die in your arms.Cause you get lighter the more it gets dark.I'm gonna give you my heart. I don't care, go on and tear me apart.I don't care if you do, ooh!Cause in a sky.cause in a sky full of stars.I think I see you.I think I see you. I love that song too! I also love Cheerleader by Omi - such sweet, lighthearted rhythms and I love the trumpet parts. I wasn't surprised to hear it was a hit a while back in Hawaii before it ever made it to the U.S.     I also love Ed Sheeran's whistful and lovely Photograph, and the video is just about the most adorable thing ever

At the moment my favourite songs are: Nothing else matters -MetallicaLost in the echo, numb, castle of glass - Linkin ParkStairway to heaven - Led Zepplinlet it be- Beatlesa working class hero is something to be,give peace a chance, imagine, gimme the truth - john lennonbuffalo soldiers , no woman no cry , could you be loved - bob marleyrasputin - bonney mThere are many but currently these songs came to my mind.

"Anything that sounds good, I like it". It can be gospel, rock, whatever. The songs in my phone include Taylor Swift, Skrillex, System of A Down, and soooooo much more. To actually answer your question, for some reason I unexpectedly got an interest in Bohemian Rhapsody by Queen. So as of now, Bohemian Rhapsody is my go to.

It's constantly changing, but i would have to say that my current favourite song is 'Secrets' by Tiesto. I'd never really been into Tiesto, but when i heard 'Firestone' and 'The Only Way is Up', I was hooked.This wouldn't be my main type of music, but this just feels right :)

I have a lot of favorite songs. Usually, my favorite song is the one I listen to the most during a given time. So, by that definition, my favorite song right now would be: Pink Floyd - Dogs  Dogs is taken from Pink Floyd’s 1977 album “Animals”. It runs 17 minutes long, and takes up most of side one of the vinyl release.

My favorite song at a given moment may well not be my favorite song several moments later.  Such feelings for a tune are rather fluid.  But if I were to answer right this moment it would be Fool For Love by Lord Huron.  It combines the old Bo Diddley riff with nuances associated with Buddy Holly and The Beach Boys.  Quite a combo for a single song.

Taste the feeling - Avicii & Conrad Sewell.  ...It feels good, in my heart, in my soul,When you're right here beside meI don't ever want this day to endWe can watch the waves, have a CokeAnd you sit here beside meTake a little long my heart againSo we can feel whatever you feelTogether we built, together atNo one can stop me when I taste that feelingNothing could ever bring me downNo one can stop me when I taste that feelingNothing could ever bring me downYou make it easier to sing itYou make it easier to sing itFeels good as we stand on the shoreAnd now our hearts are jumpingGrab another Coke and let's dive inOh, my love, there's a song in my soulWhen you are around meYou make it easier to sing itSo we can feel whatever you feelTogether we built, together atNo one can stop me when I taste that feelingNothing could ever bring me downNo one can stop me when I taste that feelingNothing could ever bring me downWith every fading sunsetWe see the stars alignedWe make the simple moments last for a lifetimeSo, we can feel foreverYou and me, togetherWe stay free foreverAnd be real together.No one can stop me when I taste that feelingNothing could ever bring me downNo one can stop me when I taste that feelingNothing could ever bring me downYou make it easier to sing itYou make it easier to sing it.

My music taste is all over the place, but my two favorite songs have always been Beach Bones by Ryan Ross (former Panic! at the Disco Member; you've probably heard of that band if you listen to walk the moon) and Lost by Frank Ocean for as long as I can remember. You should definitely give them both a listen. They're amazing:)

Photograph by Ed sheeran....!! We keep this love in a photograph,We keep these memories for ourselves,Where our eyes were never closing,Our hearts were never brokenAnd times forever frozen still... So you can keep me, inside the pocket of your ripped jeans,Holding me closer till our eyes meet,You will never be alone.... And if you hurt me,That's OK Baby only words bleedInside these pages you still hold meAnd I won't ever let you go And you can fix me inside the necklace you bought you bought when you were sixteen,Keep it close to ur heart where it should be And when I am away,I will remember how u kissed meUnder the lamp post back at sixth Street,Hearing you whisper through the phone... Wait for me to come home

Wild Horses, yes old song by the Rolling Stones, hadn't heard it in years! (Even though I rarely watch tv, just listen to music mostly) Then a couple months ago while riding on the back of my new boyfriend's MC (we listen to his shuffle while riding) he had recently d/led the Stones....I have to say it was a perfect night, with the LOVE of my life....at age 51 and that old song playing that night is now my "new" favorite:)

Jean-Michel Jarre feat. Armin van Buuren - Stardust.   It has a very interesting melody - a combination of classic electronica and mordem trance. It shows that beautiful things can happen when geniuses unite, it shows how you can create something amazing when you cross the lines of a certain style or scientific field with the help of an expert in another field., when you think outside the box, as the saying goes. Of course your experience counts.
Incubus - Drive

All About Us  - by He Is We and Owl City. It's been one of my favourites for a good few months now, there's just something about it. He Is We - All About Us ft. Owl City  Wanted - by Hunter Hayes Another one of my favourites. He's not particularly well known in England but I believe he's very popular in the US. He's currently one of my favourite artists.

Pink Floyd s, "Coming back to life".I am always in deep love with the lyrics as penned by this incredible group.It empowers to exceed the thought boundaries and nevertheless impacts each soul who admires free spirit attitude to pace with the life.

Try by Colbie Caillat has an amazing message and meaning really makes me think! The message behind it is second to none and as a songwriter myself that is saying something! It's all about how many girl feel and how they try to fit in I just love it

Listen To The Man - George Ezra. I have been hearing too much of alternative rock these days, so this song was certainly an epic change for me. Besides, the music video featuring the great Ian McKellen (Magneto and Gandalf, whew! Such great characters) and George Ezra. It's just fascinating to see such a young man with a deep and soulful voice. Hear it. You'll love it.
source : YouTube
